moral_fault.label: Moral fault (moral philosophy)
moral_fault.notes_short: A normative concept used to analyze wrongdoing, responsibility, and moral evaluation.
moral_fault.notes_extended: Used across moral philosophy to discuss blameworthiness, culpability, and ethical assessment frameworks.
moral_fault.notes_research: Research routing: consult SEP entries on responsibility, moral responsibility, blame, and related normative ethics topics.

game_theory.label: Game theory (theoretical-only)
game_theory.notes_short: Formal study of strategic interaction under specified rules and payoffs. Theoretical-only.
game_theory.notes_extended: Core topics include equilibrium concepts, strategic vs extensive forms, and rational choice under interdependence. Theoretical-only.
game_theory.notes_research: Research routing: consult institutional economics/philosophy/mathematics references; theoretical-only. No video game examples.

nash_equilibrium.label: Nash equilibrium (theoretical-only)
nash_equilibrium.notes_short: A solution concept where no player can improve payoff by unilateral deviation, given others' strategies. Theoretical-only.
nash_equilibrium.notes_extended: Central to non-cooperative game theory; formal definition depends on strategy sets and payoff functions. Theoretical-only.
nash_equilibrium.notes_research: Research routing: consult institutional game theory/economics references; theoretical-only. No video game examples.
